Terryn Fray from Bailey‚Äôs bay was the only batsman to score a half Century with a knock of 52, while Dion Stovell from Cleveland County was the weekends top bowlers with figures of [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: After the first week of Bermuda Premier Division action, we take a look at the top performers and the league standings. Terryn Fray from Bailey‚Äôs bay was the only batsman to score a half Century with a knock of 52, while Dion Stovell from Cleveland County was the weekends top bowlers with figures of 9.3-1-30-7. Cleveland County are the League leaders on net run rate over the St. George‚Äôs Cricket Club and Bailey‚Äôs Bay, all three teams have 10 points. Cleveland County has a Net Run Rate of 4.541, the St. George‚Äôs Cricket Club has a net run rate of 1.900. : ,

newsArray.title: Man Who Ran Away From Delhi Cricket‚Ä¶, Gautam Gambhir Posts Cryptic Tweet
creator: admin
newsArray.description: Home Sports ‚ÄòMan Who Ran Away From Delhi Cricket‚Ä¶‚Äô, Gautam Gambhir Posts Cryptic Tweet Former India cricketer and the current mentor of IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants, Gautam Gambhir, who has been in the eye of storm since his on-field confrontation with Royal Challengers Bangalores Virat Kohli, posted a cryptic tweet on Wednesday, leaving cricket [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: New Delhi, May 4: Former India cricketer and the current mentor of IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants, Gautam Gambhir, who has been in the eye of storm since his on-field confrontation with Royal Challengers Bangalores Virat Kohli, posted a cryptic tweet on Wednesday, leaving cricket fans puzzled. The BJP MP took to his official Twitter handle to share a post, where he wrote: ‚ÄúMan who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing ‚Äòpressure‚Äô seems over eager to sell paid PR as concern for cricket! Yahi Kalyug Hai, Jaha Bhagode‚Äô Apni Adalat Chalate Hai! (This is Kalyug where ‚Äòfugitives‚Äô run their ‚Äòcourt‚Äô).‚Äù However, it was not clear as to who Gambhir was referring to. The rivalry between Gambhir and Kohli reignited on Monday when they came face-to-face after the RCB vs LSG match. Gambhir and Kohli were seen arguing over an incident that developed during the match. Kohli was deeply agitated during LSG‚Äôs innings and was even involved in a couple of ugly face-offs with Naveen-ul-Haq and Amit Mishra of LSG. An eyewitness, who was in one of the team dug-outs, gave a lowdown of events to PTI. ‚ÄúYou saw on TV that Mayers and Virat were walking side by side for a few metres post match. Mayers asked Kohli why was he constantly abusing them and Virat, in turn, questioned why was he (Mayers) ‚Äòstaring‚Äô at him? Before that (Amit) Mishra had complained to umpire about Virat constantly abusing Naveen (ul-Haq), who is a No. 10 batter. ‚ÄúGautam, sensing that things could turn ugly, pulled Mayers and told him not to have a conversation, when Virat made a comment. The heated exchange that followed seemed a bit juvenile,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúGautam asked ‚ÄòKya bol raha hain bol‚Äô (What were you saying?) and Virat replied, ‚ÄòMaine aapko kuch bola hi naahin, aap kyon ghus rahein ho‚Äô (Why are you coming in between when I haven‚Äôt told you anything). ‚ÄúGautam responded, ‚ÄòTuney agar mere player ko bola hai, matlab tune meri family ko gaali diya hai. (You abused my player and that‚Äôs like abusing my family) and Virat‚Äôs reply was, ‚ÄòToh aap apne family ko sambhal ke rakhiye‚Äô. (Then you take care of your family). ‚ÄúGambhir‚Äôs final reply before they were separated was, ‚ÄòToh ab tu mujhe sikhayega‚Ä¶‚Äô (So now I have to learn from you‚Ä¶).‚Äù The eyewitness said that while it was tense and a blow away from turning into a free-for-all, it all seemed a bit juvenile at both ends. newsArray.title: Fastest women‚Äôs bowler Shabnim Ismail retires from international cricket
creator: AFP
newsArray.description: South African fast bowler Shabnim Ismail, who is credited with sending down the quickest delivery in women‚Äôs cricket, announced her retirement from the international game on Wednesday. During the T20 World Cup semi-final against England in Cape Town in February she bowled a 128kmh (80mph) delivery ‚Äì the fastest recorded in the women‚Äôs game. Shabnim [‚Ä¶] The post Fastest women‚Äôs bowler Shabnim Ismail retires from international cricket appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: During the T20 World Cup semi-final against England in Cape Town in February she bowled a 128kmh (80mph) delivery ‚Äì the fastest recorded in the women‚Äôs game. Shabnim Ismail, 34, said in a statement issued by Cricket South Africa that she wanted to spend more time with her family but would continue to be available to play in domestic Twenty20 tournaments around the world. She ended her international career on a high when she was a member of the first South African team, men or women, to reach a World Cup final. She took two for 26 in the final against Australia in Cape Town but it was not enough to prevent Australia winning their fifth title. Ismail made her international debut as a teenager in 2007 and went on to appear in 241 international matches. She took 191 wickets in 127 one-day internationals, second only to India‚Äôs Jhulan Goswami, and took 123 wickets in T20 internationals to be fourth on the all-time list. She took three wickets in her only Test match against the Netherlands in 2007. She missed South Africa‚Äôs one-off Test in England in 2022 because of injury. ‚ÄúAs any athlete knows, training and competing at your best requires much sacrifice and dedication, and I now find myself wanting to spend more time with my family, particularly my siblings and parents as they get older,‚Äù Ismail said in her statement.

newsArray.title: IPL 2023: Punjab dazzle; Mumbai out-dazzles
creator: Sriram Veera
newsArray.content: Synopsis: Surya-Kishan dazzle to make a mockery of a 200-plus chase after Chawla stars even as Jitesh Sharma flays a weak Mumbai bowling attack Surya-Kishan dazzle When Cameron Green swished wildly and missed continuously after Rohit Sharma had exited the third ball, the 215-run chase seemed to be going nowhere. But when Rishi Dhawan made the mistake of bowling length, Ishan Kishan had two murderous swings to thwack them over the onside boundary. Though Green fell in the next over, the sixth of the innings, the game would change with the arrival of Suryakumar Yadav. Recommended for you 1 IPL 2023, PBKS vs MI emotional rollercoaster: Tilak Varma the finisher, Matthew Short loves short stuff and unlucky Jofra Archer 2 Man who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing pressure‚Ä¶: Gautam Gambhir posts cryptic tweet 3 Watch: Stunned Marcus Stoinis confirms his dismissal from umpire after a dreamy Ravindra Jadeja ball castles his stumps The momentum completely switched in the middle overs between the 9th to 11th against Punjab‚Äôs spinners Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar. With the pitch a batting beauty by then, Kishan went so hard at the spinners; they had the feel of the slogs with his scything bat-swings that finish over his shoulder but the ball traversed in the conventional spaces like straight down the ground. As many as 38 runs came in those 3 overs and there was a discernible shift in the game: Punjab couldn‚Äôt now depend on the spinners and had to drag in the seamers. But if Kishan plundered spin, Surya robbed the pacers with a smile on his face. 100- partnership up in no time! @ishankishan51 & @surya_14kumar have made this chase look effortless so far. Follow the match ‚Äì https://t.co/QDEf6eqX22 #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI pic.twitter.com/qERm0rYWzE ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Not that there is an absence of a naturalness in Suryakumar‚Äôs batting, but that constructed idea of modern-day T20 batting has seeped in so naturally. He hits into unique places with ultra-powerful wrists. He still comes from the same solid base that is nonnegotiable but if one were to list out its mechanics ‚Äì the various terms like ‚Äòset-up at crease‚Äô, ‚Äòshape‚Äô, ‚Äòunweighting of bat‚Äô, ‚Äòcorrect position‚Äô, can be used. He walloped Sam Curran for two fours and two sixes in the 13th over that went for 27 that seemed to settle any doubts about where the game was heading. The first ball was a SKY Special, a full-length ball outside off not sliced or squeezed or squirted away but with that rubber-wrist he gracefully sliced it up and over backward point for a splendid six. The next ball from Curran was a weak length ball outside off and Surya went down on his knee to dispose it over cover boundary, and held his pose as well. The next was a fuller, attempted yorker perhaps, but Surya whip-flicked it right past a startled Curran who took evasive action rather than attempt any heroic catch. Then came the Surya sweep, where he finishes up as if he were throwing a towel over his shoulder. ùôéùôàùòºùòæùôÜùôÄùòø! Fifty partnership up between Ishan Kishan & SKY 1Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£ up for Mumbai Indians üî•üî• Follow the match ‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/QDEf6eqX22 #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI pic.twitter.com/WL7fnpiI8b ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Both fell in the end overs but with the satisfaction that the job was done and Tilak Varma ensured it was a done deal, smoking in a few big hits. That‚Äôs that from Match 46. @mipaltan register a 6-wicket win against #PBKS to add to crucial points to their tally. #MI chase down the target in 18.5 overs. Scorecard ‚Äì https://t.co/IPLsfnImuP #TATAIPL #PBKSvMI #IPL2023 pic.twitter.com/SeKR48s9Vv ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Chawla stars Piyush Chawla has the most wickets (14) in the overs between 7 and 15. He bossed the middle overs yet again against Punjab Kings , taking out Shikhar Dhawan and Matt Short with his two different googlies. Piyush Chawla gets the key breakthrough! Shikhar Dhawan steps down, but is stumped by Ishan Kishan. Live ‚Äì https://t.co/IPLsfnImuP #TATAIPL #PBKSvMI #IPL2023 pic.twitter.com/fd4blfWR11 ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Dhawan‚Äôs dismissal was a peach; Short‚Äôs was always coming. Dhawan had just charged him to ping the straight boundary and came out again but Chawla had the experience to anticipate that. He went slightly wider and slid that finger-googly across Dhawan who couldn‚Äôt connect with his flail and was stumped. Chawla‚Äôs other googly is the back-of-the-hand version when he wants it to spin more and a lot slower. The finger-one comes with pace and camouflage. And so, he tossed up the back-of-the-hand wrong‚Äôun to Short, who had an almighty swing at it, was too early with his hack, and was bowled. 8Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ runs 4Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ balls 7Ô∏è‚É£ fours 6Ô∏è‚É£ sixes It was raining fours and sixes courtesy of @liaml4893 ‚Äòs supreme striking üí•üí• #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI Sit back and enjoy the Livingstone storm üé•üîΩ https://t.co/rTO5jP6pG7 ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Jofra‚Äôs nightmarish night It didn‚Äôt help their cause that Jofra Archer‚Äôs elbow hasn‚Äôt quite healed yet. Or so it seemed; Brett Lee definitely thought so as he started to count the high number of slower ones that Archer bowled on a loop suggesting, ‚Äúthe elbow is still sore‚Äù. As he continued to leak runs (21 in his 2nd, and 27 in his final) Lee‚Äôs verdict turned more critical. ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt do what you have been paid to do, then you are better off to go off the field ‚Ä¶ he is masking his sore elbow (with the slower ones).‚Äù And when Robin Uthappa suggested it could be difficult to comeback after injury, Lee didn‚Äôt let that sentiment linger: ‚ÄúSorry, it comes to mind. You have to trick your body to forget the pain and bowl.‚Äù Jitesh‚Äôs poise Also Read 'I have come to play in the IPL, not to take abuses,' says Naveen-ul-Haq:... Man who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing pressure...: Gautam Gambhir po... KL Rahul likely to miss remainder of IPL, doubtful for WTC Final Blow-by-blow of Kohli-Gambhir spat: A flashpoint on field after a free-hi... Advertisement There is an absence of bossiness in Jitesh‚Äôs body language at the crease. Quite calm, steady, and no discernible predetermination. In some sense, his set up at the crease reminds one of the Sri Lankan dasher Tillakaratne Dilshan, in his furious swings off length deliveries and in the square slices through point balls that fall just short of yorker. Like Dilshan, Jitesh too likes to play the laps over short fine-leg, though on Wednesday night, he shelved it completely, instead focussing on going downtown. Jitesh Sharma got going immediately with the bat and stitched a solid partnership with Liam Livingstone üí™üèª #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI Revisit his knock here üé•üîΩ https://t.co/xkpooOEX2N ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 And to think he was an opener, until after a dip in form post 2017, he worked on his skills to convert himself into a finisher. As he told this newspaper, ‚ÄúAs an opener it is very difficult to get into any IPL team. I was well aware. There was a dip also. Post 2017, I was not able to perform well. I worked on my skills.‚Äù He and Livingstone did their best, but were out-dazzled by the Surya-Kishan show.

newsArray.title: PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: KARACHI: Dominant Pakistan put on an all-round show to storm past New Zealand in the third PAK vs NZ ODI to win the five-match series 3-0 with two games to spare. Watch PAK vs NZ Live Match in HD Streaming The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National [‚Ä¶] The post PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National Bank Cricket Arena here on Wednesday. New Zealand captain Tom Latham opted to bowl first after the coin flipped in his favour. Pakistan, in response, put up a decent total on the scoreboard at the back of brilliant half-centuries by Imam-ul-Haq and . Imam-ul-Haq smashed seven boundaries and a six on his way to top score for Pakistan with a 107-ball 90. Babar Azam, on the other hand, was also impressive with the bat as he notched up 54 runs in 62 balls, laced up with three boundaries and a six. The target set by the green shirts turned out to be too much for as they succumbed to their third straight defeat in the ongoing five-match series despite a brilliant start by their openers ‚Äì Will Young and Tom Blundell. Blundell remained the top scorer for the touring side with a 78-ball 65, which featured seven boundaries.

newsArray.title: India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings
creator: Ayman
newsArray.description: India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. The post India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings appeared first on Khmer Times.
newsArray.content: NEW DELHI ‚Äì India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. England remained number three in Tests but reduced the gap behind the top two teams significantly, the rankings published by the ICC showed. England have won 10 out of 12 Tests since captain Ben Stokes and coach Brendon McCullum joined forces last year following a woeful run of one win in 17 matches. The new annual rankings reflect all series completed since May 2020 and drop results from the 2019-20 season, the ICC said. India last topped the Test rankings for a month in December 2021, while Australia has been number one since January 2022 after hammering England 4-0 in the Ashes. The table remained otherwise unchanged, with South Africa fourth and New Zealand fifth ahead of Pakistan, Sri Lanka, West Indies, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe. Afghanistan and Ireland have yet to play enough Tests to earn a place in the rankings table. India remained number one in the T20 rankings, increasing their lead over second-placed England, while New Zealand overtook Pakistan and South Africa to be third. Australia are sixth ahead of West Indies, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. The new rankings for one-day internationals will be released on May 10. AFP

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù
creator: Vishnu Reddy
newsArray.description: The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) [‚Ä¶] The post ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù appeared first on Gud Story.
newsArray.content: Home Sports Cricket ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù by Vishnu Reddy May 3, 2023 in Cricket Reading Time: 3 mins read 0 Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir (Image Credit: Twitter) Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Table of Contents The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) win against Lucknow Supergiant‚Äôs (LSG). As the two franchises shook hands after the conclusion of the match, it was Kohli and Gambhir who grabbed eyeballs as they were seen engaging in an argument. Notably, Gambhir was seen pointing fingers at Kohli upon which the latter did not hold back and charged towards him. It seems like Gambhir wanted to confront Virat Kohli about his chats with Naveen-ul-Haq when the latter was batting in a tense chase. There were also finger-on-mouth celebrations from Virat Kohli when he took the catch of Krunal, perhaps responding to a similar celebration from Gambhir when LSG had defeated RCB at the Chinnaswamy earlier this season. ‚ÄúVirat Kohli was abusing Naveen . I intervened and told K Mayers to go and ask him what colour is your IPL Trophy . After listening to that he came up to me & complained . I asked him to put his 50+ score in WC knockouts on the table , he left‚Äù. Gautam Gambhir via Cricbuzz The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir confrontation after LSG vs RCB match (Image Credit: Twitter) The confrontation between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli during the LSG vs RCB match was a surprising and unfortunate event. Following the incident, both players were fined 100% of their match fees.The incident also received widespread coverage in the media, and many people were left wondering what would happen next. Fortunately, both players were able to put the incident behind them and move forward. They issued statements apologizing for their behavior and expressing their desire to move on from the incident. Overall, while the confrontation was certainly regrettable, it is good to see that both were able to learn from their mistakes and move on. ADVERTISEMENT Sport can be a highly charged and emotional activity, and it is important for players to remember to stay calm and composed, even in the heat of the moment. By doing so, they can help to ensure that the game remains enjoyable and fair for everyone involved. The recent ugly fight between Gambhir and Kohli after the LSG vs RCB match has brought to light the need for a more professional attitude in the world of cricket. While it‚Äôs understandable that emotions can run high during a game, resorting to physical altercations is never acceptable. Both players were fined 100% of their match fee, a clear signal that such behavior will not be tolerated. It‚Äôs important for players to remember that they are role models for the millions of fans who look up to them. They should strive to set an example of fair play and sportsmanship, both on and off the field. Let‚Äôs hope that this incident serves as a wake-up call for all cricket players to conduct themselves in a professional and respectful manner. Read More: Kevin Durant Lauds Steph Curry for Breaking His Game 7 Scoring Record Tags: Gambhir Kohli Related Posts ICC World Cup 2023 Schedule, Teams, Venues May 1, 2023 The IPL is on track to Surpass the NFL, Says IPL Founder Lalit Modi April 30, 2023 Andre Russell Not Pleased, Holds Entire KKR Team Accountable for Loss to GT April 29, 2023 Our bowlers will come back strong: Wasim Jaffer April 29, 2023

creator: Sriram Veera
newsArray.content: Synopsis: Surya-Kishan dazzle to make a mockery of a 200-plus chase after Chawla stars even as Jitesh Sharma flays a weak Mumbai bowling attack Surya-Kishan dazzle When Cameron Green swished wildly and missed continuously after Rohit Sharma had exited the third ball, the 215-run chase seemed to be going nowhere. But when Rishi Dhawan made the mistake of bowling length, Ishan Kishan had two murderous swings to thwack them over the onside boundary. Though Green fell in the next over, the sixth of the innings, the game would change with the arrival of Suryakumar Yadav. Recommended for you 1 IPL 2023, PBKS vs MI emotional rollercoaster: Tilak Varma the finisher, Matthew Short loves short stuff and unlucky Jofra Archer 2 Man who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing pressure‚Ä¶: Gautam Gambhir posts cryptic tweet 3 Watch: Stunned Marcus Stoinis confirms his dismissal from umpire after a dreamy Ravindra Jadeja ball castles his stumps The momentum completely switched in the middle overs between the 9th to 11th against Punjab‚Äôs spinners Rahul Chahar and Harpreet Brar. With the pitch a batting beauty by then, Kishan went so hard at the spinners; they had the feel of the slogs with his scything bat-swings that finish over his shoulder but the ball traversed in the conventional spaces like straight down the ground. As many as 38 runs came in those 3 overs and there was a discernible shift in the game: Punjab couldn‚Äôt now depend on the spinners and had to drag in the seamers. But if Kishan plundered spin, Surya robbed the pacers with a smile on his face. 100- partnership up in no time! @ishankishan51 & @surya_14kumar have made this chase look effortless so far. Follow the match ‚Äì https://t.co/QDEf6eqX22 #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI pic.twitter.com/qERm0rYWzE ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Not that there is an absence of a naturalness in Suryakumar‚Äôs batting, but that constructed idea of modern-day T20 batting has seeped in so naturally. He hits into unique places with ultra-powerful wrists. He still comes from the same solid base that is nonnegotiable but if one were to list out its mechanics ‚Äì the various terms like ‚Äòset-up at crease‚Äô, ‚Äòshape‚Äô, ‚Äòunweighting of bat‚Äô, ‚Äòcorrect position‚Äô, can be used. He walloped Sam Curran for two fours and two sixes in the 13th over that went for 27 that seemed to settle any doubts about where the game was heading. The first ball was a SKY Special, a full-length ball outside off not sliced or squeezed or squirted away but with that rubber-wrist he gracefully sliced it up and over backward point for a splendid six. The next ball from Curran was a weak length ball outside off and Surya went down on his knee to dispose it over cover boundary, and held his pose as well. The next was a fuller, attempted yorker perhaps, but Surya whip-flicked it right past a startled Curran who took evasive action rather than attempt any heroic catch. Then came the Surya sweep, where he finishes up as if he were throwing a towel over his shoulder. ùôéùôàùòºùòæùôÜùôÄùòø! Fifty partnership up between Ishan Kishan & SKY 1Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£0Ô∏è‚É£ up for Mumbai Indians üî•üî• Follow the match ‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/QDEf6eqX22 #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI pic.twitter.com/WL7fnpiI8b ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Both fell in the end overs but with the satisfaction that the job was done and Tilak Varma ensured it was a done deal, smoking in a few big hits. That‚Äôs that from Match 46. @mipaltan register a 6-wicket win against #PBKS to add to crucial points to their tally. #MI chase down the target in 18.5 overs. Scorecard ‚Äì https://t.co/IPLsfnImuP #TATAIPL #PBKSvMI #IPL2023 pic.twitter.com/SeKR48s9Vv ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Chawla stars Piyush Chawla has the most wickets (14) in the overs between 7 and 15. He bossed the middle overs yet again against Punjab Kings , taking out Shikhar Dhawan and Matt Short with his two different googlies. Piyush Chawla gets the key breakthrough! Shikhar Dhawan steps down, but is stumped by Ishan Kishan. Live ‚Äì https://t.co/IPLsfnImuP #TATAIPL #PBKSvMI #IPL2023 pic.twitter.com/fd4blfWR11 ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Dhawan‚Äôs dismissal was a peach; Short‚Äôs was always coming. Dhawan had just charged him to ping the straight boundary and came out again but Chawla had the experience to anticipate that. He went slightly wider and slid that finger-googly across Dhawan who couldn‚Äôt connect with his flail and was stumped. Chawla‚Äôs other googly is the back-of-the-hand version when he wants it to spin more and a lot slower. The finger-one comes with pace and camouflage. And so, he tossed up the back-of-the-hand wrong‚Äôun to Short, who had an almighty swing at it, was too early with his hack, and was bowled. 8Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ runs 4Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ balls 7Ô∏è‚É£ fours 6Ô∏è‚É£ sixes It was raining fours and sixes courtesy of @liaml4893 ‚Äòs supreme striking üí•üí• #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI Sit back and enjoy the Livingstone storm üé•üîΩ https://t.co/rTO5jP6pG7 ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 Jofra‚Äôs nightmarish night It didn‚Äôt help their cause that Jofra Archer‚Äôs elbow hasn‚Äôt quite healed yet. Or so it seemed; Brett Lee definitely thought so as he started to count the high number of slower ones that Archer bowled on a loop suggesting, ‚Äúthe elbow is still sore‚Äù. As he continued to leak runs (21 in his 2nd, and 27 in his final) Lee‚Äôs verdict turned more critical. ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt do what you have been paid to do, then you are better off to go off the field ‚Ä¶ he is masking his sore elbow (with the slower ones).‚Äù And when Robin Uthappa suggested it could be difficult to comeback after injury, Lee didn‚Äôt let that sentiment linger: ‚ÄúSorry, it comes to mind. You have to trick your body to forget the pain and bowl.‚Äù Jitesh‚Äôs poise Also Read 'I have come to play in the IPL, not to take abuses,' says Naveen-ul-Haq:... Man who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing pressure...: Gautam Gambhir po... KL Rahul likely to miss remainder of IPL, doubtful for WTC Final Blow-by-blow of Kohli-Gambhir spat: A flashpoint on field after a free-hi... Advertisement There is an absence of bossiness in Jitesh‚Äôs body language at the crease. Quite calm, steady, and no discernible predetermination. In some sense, his set up at the crease reminds one of the Sri Lankan dasher Tillakaratne Dilshan, in his furious swings off length deliveries and in the square slices through point balls that fall just short of yorker. Like Dilshan, Jitesh too likes to play the laps over short fine-leg, though on Wednesday night, he shelved it completely, instead focussing on going downtown. Jitesh Sharma got going immediately with the bat and stitched a solid partnership with Liam Livingstone üí™üèª #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI Revisit his knock here üé•üîΩ https://t.co/xkpooOEX2N ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 And to think he was an opener, until after a dip in form post 2017, he worked on his skills to convert himself into a finisher. As he told this newspaper, ‚ÄúAs an opener it is very difficult to get into any IPL team. I was well aware. There was a dip also. Post 2017, I was not able to perform well. I worked on my skills.‚Äù He and Livingstone did their best, but were out-dazzled by the Surya-Kishan show.

newsArray.title: PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: KARACHI: Dominant Pakistan put on an all-round show to storm past New Zealand in the third PAK vs NZ ODI to win the five-match series 3-0 with two games to spare. Watch PAK vs NZ Live Match in HD Streaming The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National [‚Ä¶] The post PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National Bank Cricket Arena here on Wednesday. New Zealand captain Tom Latham opted to bowl first after the coin flipped in his favour. Pakistan, in response, put up a decent total on the scoreboard at the back of brilliant half-centuries by Imam-ul-Haq and . Imam-ul-Haq smashed seven boundaries and a six on his way to top score for Pakistan with a 107-ball 90. Babar Azam, on the other hand, was also impressive with the bat as he notched up 54 runs in 62 balls, laced up with three boundaries and a six. The target set by the green shirts turned out to be too much for as they succumbed to their third straight defeat in the ongoing five-match series despite a brilliant start by their openers ‚Äì Will Young and Tom Blundell. Blundell remained the top scorer for the touring side with a 78-ball 65, which featured seven boundaries.

newsArray.title: India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings
creator: Ayman
newsArray.description: India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. The post India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings appeared first on Khmer Times.
newsArray.content: NEW DELHI ‚Äì India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. England remained number three in Tests but reduced the gap behind the top two teams significantly, the rankings published by the ICC showed. England have won 10 out of 12 Tests since captain Ben Stokes and coach Brendon McCullum joined forces last year following a woeful run of one win in 17 matches. The new annual rankings reflect all series completed since May 2020 and drop results from the 2019-20 season, the ICC said. India last topped the Test rankings for a month in December 2021, while Australia has been number one since January 2022 after hammering England 4-0 in the Ashes. The table remained otherwise unchanged, with South Africa fourth and New Zealand fifth ahead of Pakistan, Sri Lanka, West Indies, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe. Afghanistan and Ireland have yet to play enough Tests to earn a place in the rankings table. India remained number one in the T20 rankings, increasing their lead over second-placed England, while New Zealand overtook Pakistan and South Africa to be third. Australia are sixth ahead of West Indies, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. The new rankings for one-day internationals will be released on May 10. AFP

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù
creator: Vishnu Reddy
newsArray.description: The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) [‚Ä¶] The post ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù appeared first on Gud Story.
newsArray.content: Home Sports Cricket ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù by Vishnu Reddy May 3, 2023 in Cricket Reading Time: 3 mins read 0 Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir (Image Credit: Twitter) Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Table of Contents The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) win against Lucknow Supergiant‚Äôs (LSG). As the two franchises shook hands after the conclusion of the match, it was Kohli and Gambhir who grabbed eyeballs as they were seen engaging in an argument. Notably, Gambhir was seen pointing fingers at Kohli upon which the latter did not hold back and charged towards him. It seems like Gambhir wanted to confront Virat Kohli about his chats with Naveen-ul-Haq when the latter was batting in a tense chase. There were also finger-on-mouth celebrations from Virat Kohli when he took the catch of Krunal, perhaps responding to a similar celebration from Gambhir when LSG had defeated RCB at the Chinnaswamy earlier this season. ‚ÄúVirat Kohli was abusing Naveen . I intervened and told K Mayers to go and ask him what colour is your IPL Trophy . After listening to that he came up to me & complained . I asked him to put his 50+ score in WC knockouts on the table , he left‚Äù. Gautam Gambhir via Cricbuzz The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir confrontation after LSG vs RCB match (Image Credit: Twitter) The confrontation between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli during the LSG vs RCB match was a surprising and unfortunate event. Following the incident, both players were fined 100% of their match fees.The incident also received widespread coverage in the media, and many people were left wondering what would happen next. Fortunately, both players were able to put the incident behind them and move forward. They issued statements apologizing for their behavior and expressing their desire to move on from the incident. Overall, while the confrontation was certainly regrettable, it is good to see that both were able to learn from their mistakes and move on. ADVERTISEMENT Sport can be a highly charged and emotional activity, and it is important for players to remember to stay calm and composed, even in the heat of the moment. By doing so, they can help to ensure that the game remains enjoyable and fair for everyone involved. The recent ugly fight between Gambhir and Kohli after the LSG vs RCB match has brought to light the need for a more professional attitude in the world of cricket. While it‚Äôs understandable that emotions can run high during a game, resorting to physical altercations is never acceptable. Both players were fined 100% of their match fee, a clear signal that such behavior will not be tolerated. It‚Äôs important for players to remember that they are role models for the millions of fans who look up to them. They should strive to set an example of fair play and sportsmanship, both on and off the field. Let‚Äôs hope that this incident serves as a wake-up call for all cricket players to conduct themselves in a professional and respectful manner. Read More: Kevin Durant Lauds Steph Curry for Breaking His Game 7 Scoring Record Tags: Gambhir Kohli Related Posts ICC World Cup 2023 Schedule, Teams, Venues May 1, 2023 The IPL is on track to Surpass the NFL, Says IPL Founder Lalit Modi April 30, 2023 Andre Russell Not Pleased, Holds Entire KKR Team Accountable for Loss to GT April 29, 2023 Our bowlers will come back strong: Wasim Jaffer April 29, 2023

newsArray.title: Premier Cricket Standings & Top Performers
creator: temp
newsArray.description: After the first week of Bermuda Premier Division Cricket action, we take a look at the top performers and the league standings. Terryn Fray from Bailey‚Äôs bay was the only batsman to score a half Century with a knock of 52, while Dion Stovell from Cleveland County was the weekends top bowlers with figures of [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: After the first week of Bermuda Premier Division action, we take a look at the top performers and the league standings. Terryn Fray from Bailey‚Äôs bay was the only batsman to score a half Century with a knock of 52, while Dion Stovell from Cleveland County was the weekends top bowlers with figures of 9.3-1-30-7. Cleveland County are the League leaders on net run rate over the St. George‚Äôs Cricket Club and Bailey‚Äôs Bay, all three teams have 10 points. Cleveland County has a Net Run Rate of 4.541, the St. George‚Äôs Cricket Club has a net run rate of 1.900. : ,

newsArray.title: Man Who Ran Away From Delhi Cricket‚Ä¶, Gautam Gambhir Posts Cryptic Tweet
creator: admin
newsArray.description: Home Sports ‚ÄòMan Who Ran Away From Delhi Cricket‚Ä¶‚Äô, Gautam Gambhir Posts Cryptic Tweet Former India cricketer and the current mentor of IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants, Gautam Gambhir, who has been in the eye of storm since his on-field confrontation with Royal Challengers Bangalores Virat Kohli, posted a cryptic tweet on Wednesday, leaving cricket [‚Ä¶]
newsArray.content: New Delhi, May 4: Former India cricketer and the current mentor of IPL franchise Lucknow Super Giants, Gautam Gambhir, who has been in the eye of storm since his on-field confrontation with Royal Challengers Bangalores Virat Kohli, posted a cryptic tweet on Wednesday, leaving cricket fans puzzled. The BJP MP took to his official Twitter handle to share a post, where he wrote: ‚ÄúMan who ran away from Delhi Cricket citing ‚Äòpressure‚Äô seems over eager to sell paid PR as concern for cricket! Yahi Kalyug Hai, Jaha Bhagode‚Äô Apni Adalat Chalate Hai! (This is Kalyug where ‚Äòfugitives‚Äô run their ‚Äòcourt‚Äô).‚Äù However, it was not clear as to who Gambhir was referring to. The rivalry between Gambhir and Kohli reignited on Monday when they came face-to-face after the RCB vs LSG match. Gambhir and Kohli were seen arguing over an incident that developed during the match. Kohli was deeply agitated during LSG‚Äôs innings and was even involved in a couple of ugly face-offs with Naveen-ul-Haq and Amit Mishra of LSG. An eyewitness, who was in one of the team dug-outs, gave a lowdown of events to PTI. ‚ÄúYou saw on TV that Mayers and Virat were walking side by side for a few metres post match. Mayers asked Kohli why was he constantly abusing them and Virat, in turn, questioned why was he (Mayers) ‚Äòstaring‚Äô at him? Before that (Amit) Mishra had complained to umpire about Virat constantly abusing Naveen (ul-Haq), who is a No. 10 batter. ‚ÄúGautam, sensing that things could turn ugly, pulled Mayers and told him not to have a conversation, when Virat made a comment. The heated exchange that followed seemed a bit juvenile,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúGautam asked ‚ÄòKya bol raha hain bol‚Äô (What were you saying?) and Virat replied, ‚ÄòMaine aapko kuch bola hi naahin, aap kyon ghus rahein ho‚Äô (Why are you coming in between when I haven‚Äôt told you anything). ‚ÄúGautam responded, ‚ÄòTuney agar mere player ko bola hai, matlab tune meri family ko gaali diya hai. (You abused my player and that‚Äôs like abusing my family) and Virat‚Äôs reply was, ‚ÄòToh aap apne family ko sambhal ke rakhiye‚Äô. (Then you take care of your family). ‚ÄúGambhir‚Äôs final reply before they were separated was, ‚ÄòToh ab tu mujhe sikhayega‚Ä¶‚Äô (So now I have to learn from you‚Ä¶).‚Äù The eyewitness said that while it was tense and a blow away from turning into a free-for-all, it all seemed a bit juvenile at both ends. (With Agency Inputs) $(document).ready(function(){ $('#commentbtn').on("click",function(){ (function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/all.js#xfbml=1&appId=178196885542208"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs); }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk')); $(".cmntbox").toggle(); }); }); Source link

newsArray.title: Fastest women‚Äôs bowler Shabnim Ismail retires from international cricket
creator: AFP
newsArray.description: South African fast bowler Shabnim Ismail, who is credited with sending down the quickest delivery in women‚Äôs cricket, announced her retirement from the international game on Wednesday. During the T20 World Cup semi-final against England in Cape Town in February she bowled a 128kmh (80mph) delivery ‚Äì the fastest recorded in the women‚Äôs game. Shabnim [‚Ä¶] The post Fastest women‚Äôs bowler Shabnim Ismail retires from international cricket appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: During the T20 World Cup semi-final against England in Cape Town in February she bowled a 128kmh (80mph) delivery ‚Äì the fastest recorded in the women‚Äôs game. Shabnim Ismail, 34, said in a statement issued by Cricket South Africa that she wanted to spend more time with her family but would continue to be available to play in domestic Twenty20 tournaments around the world. She ended her international career on a high when she was a member of the first South African team, men or women, to reach a World Cup final. She took two for 26 in the final against Australia in Cape Town but it was not enough to prevent Australia winning their fifth title. Ismail made her international debut as a teenager in 2007 and went on to appear in 241 international matches. She took 191 wickets in 127 one-day internationals, second only to India‚Äôs Jhulan Goswami, and took 123 wickets in T20 internationals to be fourth on the all-time list. She took three wickets in her only Test match against the Netherlands in 2007. She missed South Africa‚Äôs one-off Test in England in 2022 because of injury. ‚ÄúAs any athlete knows, training and competing at your best requires much sacrifice and dedication, and I now find myself wanting to spend more time with my family, particularly my siblings and parents as they get older,‚Äù Ismail said in her statement.

Advertisement There is an absence of bossiness in Jitesh‚Äôs body language at the crease. Quite calm, steady, and no discernible predetermination. In some sense, his set up at the crease reminds one of the Sri Lankan dasher Tillakaratne Dilshan, in his furious swings off length deliveries and in the square slices through point balls that fall just short of yorker. Like Dilshan, Jitesh too likes to play the laps over short fine-leg, though on Wednesday night, he shelved it completely, instead focussing on going downtown. Jitesh Sharma got going immediately with the bat and stitched a solid partnership with Liam Livingstone üí™üèª #TATAIPL | #PBKSvMI Revisit his knock here üé•üîΩ https://t.co/xkpooOEX2N ‚Äî IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) May 3, 2023 And to think he was an opener, until after a dip in form post 2017, he worked on his skills to convert himself into a finisher. As he told this newspaper, ‚ÄúAs an opener it is very difficult to get into any IPL team. I was well aware. There was a dip also. Post 2017, I was not able to perform well. I worked on my skills.‚Äù He and Livingstone did their best, but were out-dazzled by the Surya-Kishan show.

newsArray.title: PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph
creator: A Sports
newsArray.description: KARACHI: Dominant Pakistan put on an all-round show to storm past New Zealand in the third PAK vs NZ ODI to win the five-match series 3-0 with two games to spare. Watch PAK vs NZ Live Match in HD Streaming The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National [‚Ä¶] The post PAK vs NZ: All-round Pakistan edge New Zealand to seal series triumph appeared first on ASports.tv.
newsArray.content: The third PAK vs NZ ODI of the five-match series was played here at the National Bank Cricket Arena here on Wednesday. New Zealand captain Tom Latham opted to bowl first after the coin flipped in his favour. Pakistan, in response, put up a decent total on the scoreboard at the back of brilliant half-centuries by Imam-ul-Haq and . Imam-ul-Haq smashed seven boundaries and a six on his way to top score for Pakistan with a 107-ball 90. Babar Azam, on the other hand, was also impressive with the bat as he notched up 54 runs in 62 balls, laced up with three boundaries and a six. The target set by the green shirts turned out to be too much for as they succumbed to their third straight defeat in the ongoing five-match series despite a brilliant start by their openers ‚Äì Will Young and Tom Blundell. Blundell remained the top scorer for the touring side with a 78-ball 65, which featured seven boundaries.

newsArray.title: India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings
creator: Ayman
newsArray.description: India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. The post India overtake Australia at top of ICC Test rankings appeared first on Khmer Times.
newsArray.content: NEW DELHI ‚Äì India overtook Australia on Tuesday to go number one in new Test rankings issued by the International Cricket Council, while also retaining the top position in T20s. England remained number three in Tests but reduced the gap behind the top two teams significantly, the rankings published by the ICC showed. England have won 10 out of 12 Tests since captain Ben Stokes and coach Brendon McCullum joined forces last year following a woeful run of one win in 17 matches. The new annual rankings reflect all series completed since May 2020 and drop results from the 2019-20 season, the ICC said. India last topped the Test rankings for a month in December 2021, while Australia has been number one since January 2022 after hammering England 4-0 in the Ashes. The table remained otherwise unchanged, with South Africa fourth and New Zealand fifth ahead of Pakistan, Sri Lanka, West Indies, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe. Afghanistan and Ireland have yet to play enough Tests to earn a place in the rankings table. India remained number one in the T20 rankings, increasing their lead over second-placed England, while New Zealand overtook Pakistan and South Africa to be third. Australia are sixth ahead of West Indies, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. The new rankings for one-day internationals will be released on May 10. AFP

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù
creator: Vishnu Reddy
newsArray.description: The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) [‚Ä¶] The post ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù appeared first on Gud Story.
newsArray.content: Home Sports Cricket ‚ÄúGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli‚Äôs Feud Takes Center Stage After LSG vs RCB Match‚Äù by Vishnu Reddy May 3, 2023 in Cricket Reading Time: 3 mins read 0 Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir (Image Credit: Twitter) Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Table of Contents The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli The match between LSG and RCB was an intense one, with both teams putting up a great fight. However, what stole the limelight was the ugly fight between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli towards the end of the match. Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir got involved in a verbal fight after Royal Challengers Bangalore‚Äôs (RCB) win against Lucknow Supergiant‚Äôs (LSG). As the two franchises shook hands after the conclusion of the match, it was Kohli and Gambhir who grabbed eyeballs as they were seen engaging in an argument. Notably, Gambhir was seen pointing fingers at Kohli upon which the latter did not hold back and charged towards him. It seems like Gambhir wanted to confront Virat Kohli about his chats with Naveen-ul-Haq when the latter was batting in a tense chase. There were also finger-on-mouth celebrations from Virat Kohli when he took the catch of Krunal, perhaps responding to a similar celebration from Gambhir when LSG had defeated RCB at the Chinnaswamy earlier this season. ‚ÄúVirat Kohli was abusing Naveen . I intervened and told K Mayers to go and ask him what colour is your IPL Trophy . After listening to that he came up to me & complained . I asked him to put his 50+ score in WC knockouts on the table , he left‚Äù. Gautam Gambhir via Cricbuzz The aftermath of the confrontation between Gambhir and Kohli Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir confrontation after LSG vs RCB match (Image Credit: Twitter) The confrontation between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli during the LSG vs RCB match was a surprising and unfortunate event. Following the incident, both players were fined 100% of their match fees.The incident also received widespread coverage in the media, and many people were left wondering what would happen next. Fortunately, both players were able to put the incident behind them and move forward. They issued statements apologizing for their behavior and expressing their desire to move on from the incident. Overall, while the confrontation was certainly regrettable, it is good to see that both were able to learn from their mistakes and move on. ADVERTISEMENT Sport can be a highly charged and emotional activity, and it is important for players to remember to stay calm and composed, even in the heat of the moment. By doing so, they can help to ensure that the game remains enjoyable and fair for everyone involved. The recent ugly fight between Gambhir and Kohli after the LSG vs RCB match has brought to light the need for a more professional attitude in the world of cricket. While it‚Äôs understandable that emotions can run high during a game, resorting to physical altercations is never acceptable. Both players were fined 100% of their match fee, a clear signal that such behavior will not be tolerated. It‚Äôs important for players to remember that they are role models for the millions of fans who look up to them. They should strive to set an example of fair play and sportsmanship, both on and off the field. Let‚Äôs hope that this incident serves as a wake-up call for all cricket players to conduct themselves in a professional and respectful manner.
